meanings.definition: A person who favors the abolition of a practice or institution, especially slavery.
meanings.sent1: The abolitionists fought tirelessly to end slavery in the country.
meanings.sent2: Many abolitionists risked their lives to help enslaved people escape to freedom.
meanings.sent3: The abolitionists organized peaceful protests to advocate for the end of slavery.
meanings.sent4: In history, abolitionists were like beacons of hope shining light on the darkness of slavery.
meanings.sent5: The image of abolitionists standing up against injustice is truly inspiring.

meanings.definition: Those who actively work to end a particular practice or institution, such as slavery.
meanings.sent1: Abolitionists campaigned vigorously to dismantle the oppressive system of slavery.
meanings.sent2: The abolitionists' dedication to their cause led to significant changes in society.
meanings.sent3: It was a sight to see the abolitionists strategizing to bring an end to slavery.
meanings.sent4: The impact of abolitionists' actions reverberated throughout the nation.
meanings.sent5: The courage of abolitionists in the face of adversity is commendable.
